events.message: The applicant submitted the initial loan application for purchasing a new vehicle after selecting a car from the dealership.
Loan application was categorised under Auto Loan as the applicant is seeking financing for a personal car purchase.
A loan officer with experience in automobile financing was assigned to handle and process the applicant’s auto loan request.
Initial review of the application was completed successfully, confirming eligibility criteria and vehicle details provided by the applicant.
Requested supporting documents including proof of income, vehicle purchase agreement, and identification documents from the applicant.
Applicant submitted all requested documents on time, including bank statements, employment verification, and the sales contract for the vehicle.
Credit check revealed a strong repayment history with no recent defaults or outstanding debts, supporting the loan approval potential.
Risk assessment was completed considering applicant credit score, debt-to-income ratio, and vehicle valuation for securing the loan.
Loan offer outlining terms, interest rates, and repayment schedule was formally presented to the applicant for review and acceptance.
Applicant provided feedback requesting clarification on monthly payment amounts and loan tenure, with no disputes raised.
Application was escalated to the senior underwriting team for a secondary review based on applicant’s request for extended loan term.
The loan officer and underwriting team approved the auto loan application after thorough evaluation of all submitted information.
Loan funds were disbursed to the dealership’s account as per the agreement, enabling the applicant to complete car purchase.
Follow-up call was made to the applicant to confirm receipt of funds and to provide information about loan repayment schedules.
The loan application process was formally closed with all conditions met and documentation finalized as per the lender’s requirements.
